panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: sidekiq Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

targets.expr:

  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""

  or

    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

could not be processed for some reason.

panels.content:
### Description

The number of Sidekiq jobs meeting their execution duration target based on the urgency of the worker.
By default, execution of a job should take no more than 300 seconds. But this can be adjusted by the
urgency of the worker.

Read more about this in the [runbooks doc](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/blob/master/docs/sidekiq/sidekiq-slis.md).
panels.title: Details

panels.title: sidekiq_queueing SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

The number of Sidekiq jobs meeting their queueing duration target based on the urgency of the worker.
By default, queueing of a job should take no more than 60 seconds. But this can be adjusted by the
urgency of the worker.

Read more about this in the [runbooks doc](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/blob/master/docs/sidekiq/sidekiq-slis.md).

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(type, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (type, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(type, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="sidekiq"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="sidekiq"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
This uses the working set size from cAdvisor for the cgroup's memory usage. That may
not be a good measure as it includes filesystem cache pages that are not necessarily
attributable to the application inside the cgroup, and are permitted to be evicted
instead of being OOM killed.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="sidekiq"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="sidekiq"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in the node pool for
a service fleet.

If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (type) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total:labeled{mode="idle", type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_cpu component saturation: Average Node Pool CPU Utilization

panels.content: Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è and [Grafonnet](https://github.com/grafana/grafonnet-lib). [Contribute to this dashboard on GitLab.com](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/blob/master/dashboards)
